citation.article-title: Nitrospira marina gen.nov., sp. nov.: a chemolithotrophic nitrite-oxidizing bacterium

p.s: Nitrospira (Ni.tro.spi'ra L. n. nitrum nitrate; Gr. n. spira a coil, spiral; N.L. fem. n. Nitrospira nitrate spiral)
Motile cells and resting forms not observed.
Cells grow free in liquid medium.
Cells are rich in cytochromes which impart a yellowish to brownish color to cell suspension; void of other pigments.
Obligately chemolithotrophic bacteria which oxidize nitrite to nitrate and fix CO2 to fulfill energy and carbon needs.
Grow in salt water enriched with nitrite and inorganic salts; no organic growth factors required, but best growth occurs in mixotrophic media.
Strictly aerobic using oxygen as a terminal electron acceptor.
The G+C content of the DNA is 50.0 mol% (one species, one strain).
Cultured from seawater and sediment samples from the Gulf of Maine, Black Sea, New York Harbor, Cape Cod, Atlantic Ocean off Angola, Mississippi River, and Savannah River.
